result.execSummary:
The defendant Zakariah P. Marescalco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zakariah P. Marescalco is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zakariah P. Marescalco was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zakariah P. Marescalco

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of outstanding court obligations.  Court enters civil judgment on outstanding court costs.
Probation review hearing on December 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Ct.2 -Dismissed  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states she realized after court that there was a substitution filed on Judge Warren.  Court vacates the sentence based on prior substitution.  SEH reset to 12/10/14 at 3pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; pay $250 DNA surcharge.
Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
With Atty Edwards and by agreement of ADA McNeill the SEH of 10/6/14 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, as there will be a reserve Judge covering on that date; reset to 11/17/14 at 2pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 10/6/14 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 6/20/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 7/15/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge Warren filed by Atty. Edwards. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Warren filed by Atty. Edwards. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 6-2-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

146pm

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No drug paraphernalia.  *TO SUBMIT TO BOOKING AND PROCESSING AFTER COURT TODAY.
